briefdescription.para: Can set CRS on layer or group of layers.
Can create children. Even items without this capability may have children, but cannot create them, it means that children are created by item ancestors.
CreateChildren() is fast enough to be run in main thread when refreshing items, most root items (wms,wfs,wcs,postgres...) are considered fast because they are reading data only from QgsSettings.
The collapse/expand status for this items children should be ignored in order to avoid undesired network connections (wms etc.)
Item can be renamed.
Item can be deleted.
Children not yet created.
Creating children in separate thread (populating or refreshing)
Children created.
Represents a favorite item.
Represents a QGIS project.
Custom item type.
Custom sort key. If invalid, name() will be used for sorting instead.

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsDataItem::Type type, QgsDataItem *parent, const QString &name, const QString &path)
memberdef.name: QgsDataItem

briefdescription.para: Create new data item.
Returns whether the item accepts drag and dropped layers - e.g.

detaileddescription.para:
for importing a dataset to a provider. Subclasses should override this and handleDrop() to accept dropped layers.
handleDrop()

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of actions available for this item.

detaileddescription.para: This is usually used for the popup menu on right-clicking the item. Subclasses should override this to provide actions.
Subclasses should ensure that ownership of created actions is correctly handled by parenting them to the specified parent widget.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a new child item.

detaileddescription.para:
The child will be inserted at a position using an alphabetical order based on mName.
child
child item to insert. Ownership is transferred, and item parent will be set and relevant connections made.
refresh
- set to true to refresh populated item, emitting relevant signals to the model
deleteChildItem()

briefdescription.para: Returns the capabilities for the data item.
Create children.

detaileddescription.para: Children are not expected to have parent set. This method MUST BE THREAD SAFE.

briefdescription.para: Removes and deletes a child item, emitting relevant signals to the model.

parameterdescription.para: child to remove. Item must exist as a current child.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this item is equal to another item (by testing item type and path).
Called when a user double clicks on the item.

detaileddescription.para:
Subclasses should return true if they have implemented a double-click handler and do not want the default double-click behavior for items.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Attempts to process the mime data dropped on this item.

detaileddescription.para:
Subclasses must override this and acceptDrop() if they accept dropped layers.
acceptDrop()

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item may be dragged.

detaileddescription.para:
Default implementation returns false. A draggable item has to implement mimeUri() that will be used to pass data.
mimeUri()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of menus available for this item.

detaileddescription.para:
This is usually used for the popup menu on right-clicking the item. Subclasses should override this to provide actions. Subclasses should ensure that ownership of created menus is correctly handled by parenting them to the specified parent widget.
parent
a parent widget of the menu
list of menus
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns mime URI for the data item.

detaileddescription.para:
Items that return valid URI will be returned in mime data when dragging a selection from browser model.
hasDragEnabled()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Move object and all its descendants to thread.
Returns the name of the item (the displayed text for the item).
Gets item parent.

detaileddescription.para: QgsDataItem maintains its own items hierarchy, it does not use QObject hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Removes a child item and returns it without deleting it.

detaileddescription.para:
Emits relevant signals to model as required.
child
child to remove
pointer to the removed item or null if no such item was found

briefdescription.para: Sets a new name for the item, and returns true if the item was successfully renamed.

detaileddescription.para: Items which implement this method should return the QgsDataItem::Rename capability.
The default implementation does nothing.

briefdescription.para: Sets the capabilities for the data item.
Writes the selected crs into data source.

detaileddescription.para: The original data source will be modified when calling this method.

briefdescription.para: Sets the name of the item (the displayed text for the item).
Set item parent and connect / disconnect parent to / from item signals.

detaileddescription.para: It does not add itself to parents children (mChildren)

briefdescription.para: Sets a custom sorting key for the item.
Set item state.

detaileddescription.para:
It also take care about starting/stopping loading icon animation.
state
QGIS 2.8

briefdescription.para: Returns the sorting key for the item.

detaileddescription.para: By default name() is returned, but setSortKey() can be used to set a custom sort key for the item.
Alternatively subclasses can override this method to return a custom sort key.

briefdescription.para: Create path component replacing path separators.
The item is scheduled to be deleted.

detaileddescription.para: E.g. if deleteLater() is called when item is in Populating state (createChildren() running in another thread), the deferredDelete() returns true and item will be deleted once Populating finished. Items with slow reateChildren() (for example network or database based) may check during createChildren() if deferredDelete() returns true and return from createChildren() immediately because result will be useless.

briefdescription.para: Refresh the items from a specified list of child items.
Safely delete the item:

listitem.para: unsets parent (but does not remove itself)
waits until Populating state (createChildren() in thread) finished without blocking main thread

briefdescription.para: Remove children recursively and set as not populated. This is used when refreshing collapsed items.
Refresh connections: update GUI and emit signal.

Emitted when the provider's connections of the child items have changed This signal is normally forwarded to the app in order to refresh the connection item in the provider dialogs and to refresh the connection items in the other open browsers.
Will request a repaint of this icon.
Base class for all items in the model.

detaileddescription.para: Parent/children hierarchy is not based on QObject.
